ngiemboon: Á laa na ngùʼ yesẅé, á na fʉ̀ʼ gie mefùɔ lɔ́ɔn ńgee tsẅɛɛ ncù, Jÿohab gẅie aa tándá ncù lɔg palÿɔ́ʼncù tà é gyɔ́ɔn, ńgʉa ńtág metÿǒsoŋ pʉ̀a Amoŋ, ḿbiŋ ńtíʼi tÿǒsoŋ Lamba. Fùɔ Ndavîd ké néŋe yé pɔ́ Yelúzálèm. Jÿohab kẅé tÿǒsoŋ Lamba ḿbú ńtág.
en: In the spring   when kings march out to war,  # 20:1–3 2Sm 12:26–31 Joab led the army and destroyed the Ammonites’ land. He came to Rabbah and besieged it, but David remained in Jerusalem.  # 20:1 2Sm 11:1 Joab attacked Rabbah and demolished it.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Ndavîd la tsɔ́ʼɔ cÿɔ̀ʼɔ lefùɔ gie á laa twó tútú gẅie pʉ̀a Amoŋ tóŋo lê Mikoŋ, mbà pɔ́ la lɔg ńgÿo ssé yɔb. Yɛ̌ cÿɔ̀ʼɔ lefùɔ gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, la zɛ tà ńgwɔ́ mbɔɔ mmó mekílò móm tá; mbà mé la lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ tóon, ńkẅiŋ. Mé la tɔʼɔ yɛ̌ cÿɔ̀ʼɔ lefùɔ twó Ndavîd. Afùɔ Ndavîd la lɔgɔ kìb fó tÿǒsoŋ tà á gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn.
en: Then David took the crown from the head of their king,  ,# 20:2 = Molech; 1Kg 11:5,7,# 20:2 1Kg 11:5,7 and it was placed on David’s head. He found that the crown weighed seventy-five pounds  # 20:2 Lit a talent of gold, and there was a precious stone in it. In addition, David took away a large quantity of plunder from the city.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Ndavîd la lɔg patsẅé wó ńgʉa, ńgÿo pɔ́ faʼ mefàʼ ntʉ̀tʉ̀ páʼ: leshʉ̌a peláŋ, lépagte metǒon mbɔɔ lekɔ̌ʼ metÿǒ. Fùɔ Ndavîd la gíŋe ńgÿo pɔ́ púʼu na metsɔ́ metÿǒsoŋ pʉ̀a Amoŋ. Afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, á lɔg palÿɔ́ʼncù pé ḿbiŋ nzèm né Yelúzálèm.
en: He brought out the people who were in it and put them to work with saws,   iron picks, and axes.  # 20:3 Text emended; MT reads saws; 2Sm 12:31,# 20:3 2Sm 12:31 David did the same to all the Ammonite cities. Then he and all his troops returned to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò la tɔ́g, etsɔ́ ncù gÿo ńgíŋe ńgwe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b lâ pʉ̀a Filisi á Ngezɛ̂ɛ. Á gwɔ́ púʼu, Sibekayi gẅie aa nyìŋ Ushÿa, á zẅé Sipayi gẅie à laa tsɔ̌ nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ ndá pʉ̀a Lefa, ńdɔg ḿbú sẅíʼi nzẅìŋ pʉ̀a Filisi.
en: After this,   a war broke out with the Philistines at Gezer. At that time Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, a descendant of the Rephaim,  # 20:4 Or the Rephaites,# 20:4 Gn 14:5; Dt 2:11 and the Philistines were subdued.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ncù la gÿo ńgíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó, lélÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a Filisi. Ɛlanaŋ míŋ Yayî zẅé Lamii gẅie aa fɛ̌ Ngoliyad gẅie à laa nyìŋ Ngâd, tá mbà à la gẅiin lekwoŋ, efʉ́a yɛ̌ fáŋ páʼ kùɔpɔ̀ɔn la.
en: Once again there was a battle with the Philistines, and Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath of Gath. The shaft of his spear was like a weaver’s beam.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ncù la gíŋe ńgwe á Ngâd. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ wó, ésag tɛʼ, ntóŋ mbwó mé gwɔ́ ntɔgɔ́, á na mbwó ntsèm, epúɔ tekwò pé gwɔ́ ntɔgɔ́ á na mekwò ntsèm, é pú ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ né móm mbʉ́a. À la gíŋe ńgwɔ́ yé nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ ndá Lefa.
en: There was still another battle at Gath where there was a man of extraordinary stature with six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot #— #twenty-four in all. He, too, was descended from the giant.

ngiemboon: À la gwág pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ táʼ, Jÿonataŋ gẅie aa míŋ Shʉmeya ńgwɔ́ fɛ̌ Ndavîd, á zẅé yé.
en: When he taunted Israel, Jonathan son of David’s brother Shimei killed him.

ngiemboon: Ndavîd pâ palÿɔ́ʼncù pé la zẅé palÿɔ́ʼncù pe Filisi pie é la fó Ngâd, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀ ndá Lefa.
en: These were the descendants of the giant in Gath killed by David and his soldiers.
